snippet: The F.D.A. should abandon its “lost pleasure” approach before issuing a rule regulating electronic cigarettes, cigars and other tobacco products.
abstract: Editorial criticizes cost-benefit analysis that is among important criteria for proposed Food and Drug Administration rule to regulate electronic cigarettes, cigars and other tobacco products; calls analysis, which takes into account loss of pleasure smokers experience when they quit smoking, misguided if not absurd, and calls for approach to be abandoned before issuing final rule.
lead_paragraph: The F.D.A. should abandon its “lost pleasure” approach before issuing a rule regulating electronic cigarettes, cigars and other tobacco products.
